definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: Driver was killed, van overturned on the tracks also.
sentences.chinese: 司機被打死了，囚車也翻倒在鐵軌上。

sentences.english: The fruit tumbled from the overturned cart.
sentences.chinese: 水果從翻倒的手推車裏滾出來。

sentences.english: During the race, the leading car skidded and overturned.
sentences.chinese: 領先的那輛車向一側打滑並且翻倒了。

sentences.english: We just had our first knockdown about an hour ago.
sentences.chinese: 剛在一小時前，我們經歷了第一次的翻倒。

sentences.english: In the upside-down cabin, water spouted through the hatch.
sentences.chinese: 水嘩嘩地從艙口湧進翻倒的船艙。

sentences.english: The tombstone inscriptions are blurred by a barrel of toppled red paint.
sentences.chinese: 翻倒的紅油漆已將碑文染得模糊不清。

sentences.english: Fanned by high winds, fires from overturned cookstoves and ruptured gas mains spread.
sentences.chinese: 大風吹過，火從翻倒的爐子和煤氣管道中蔓延開來。

sentences.english: The village carpenter is repairing an upturned dinghy under a big aswatha tree.
sentences.chinese: 鄉里的木匠在大樹下修着翻倒的小艇。

sentences.english: The leg of the chair broke and the chair canted over.
sentences.chinese: 一隻凳腳折斷，椅子翻倒了。

sentences.english: That wheelbarrow is top-heavy; it'll tip over.
sentences.chinese: 那輛單輪手推車重心不穩，會翻倒。

sentences.english: I righted the overturned stool and sat down on it.
sentences.chinese: 我把翻倒的凳子扶起來，然後坐了上去。

sentences.english: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他發怒，把山翻倒挪移，山並不知覺。

sentences.english: The oil-stove upset and burst into flames.
sentences.chinese: 油爐翻倒，立刻燃燒起來。

definition: to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
four legs facing the sky (idiom); flat on one's back
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to overturn/to overthrow/to strike down (an enemy)
to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
